quotes: Yudhoyono would break ranks from Wahid in July 2001 when the latter was facing impeachment.
On 23 July 2001, in a special session, the MPR impeached Wahid and replaced him with Megawati as president.

After the Bali bombings in October 2002, he oversaw the hunt for and arrest of those responsible, and gained a reputation both in Indonesia and abroad as one of the few Indonesian politicians who was serious about the war on terrorism.
On his advice, Megawati declared martial law in Aceh on 19 May 2003, which was then extended in November.
From 12 to 19 August 2001, Rumangkang began holding a series of meetings to discuss the formation of the party while holding consultations with Yudhoyono.

organizations.name: People's Representative Council (DPR)
quotes: Wahid issued a decree freezing the People's Representative Council (DPR) and then asked Yudhoyono to declare a state of emergency to further strengthen his position.

organizations.name: MPR
quotes: On 23 July 2001, in a special session, the MPR impeached Wahid and replaced him with Megawati as president.

organizations.name: Golkar
quotes: Yudhoyono threw his name in the hat and competed against Golkar's Akbar Tanjung and United Development Party's (PPP) Hamzah Haz.

quotes: Yudhoyono threw his name in the hat and competed against Golkar's Akbar Tanjung and United Development Party's (PPP) Hamzah Haz.

organizations.name: Free Aceh Movement (GAM)
quotes: Yudhoyono also dealt with the Free Aceh Movement (GAM), a separatist movement wanting to separate the Province of Aceh from Indonesia.

organizations.name: Democratic Party
quotes: Yudhoyono approved of the idea and after going through the basic concepts, left Rumangkang in charge of forming the Party.
